title: What are the difficulties in implementing ERP software? - Quora

response.answer_text: Lack of proper analysis of requirements will lead to non-availability of certain essential functionalities. This might affect the operations in the long run and reduce the productivity and profitability. Compatibility Issues with ERP Modules lead to issues in integration of modules. Companies associate different vendors to implement different ERP modules, based on their competency. It is very essential that there is a way to handle compatibility issues. ERP applications modules will require good processing speed and adequate storage. Not allocating suitable budget for infrastructure will result in reduced application speed and other software issues. Hardware and Software Security is also equally important It should be user friendly.The staff should be comfortable in using the application or else, it will backfire, with redundant work and functional inefficiencies. It is very important, that implementation is done in stages. Trying to implement everything at once will lead to a lot of confusion and chaos.

People front: First of all and ERP system will change the way the company is been operating. This could be a cultural shock for present users groups. This has to addressed first. If this is not addresses this group may tend to think that ERP is a competition for them and ERP will reduce their importance in the company. The management need to spend significant time in highlighting that without ERP system the company can not move to the next level.It is not a threat to anyone, it is going to make the work easier for all and provide better service level for the customers and save cost.If ERP is not implemented, the company will lose out with the competition.ERP is going to help every one to work smarter and better.ERP system is GST and audit friendly.Right ERP softwareRight ERP software It is extremely important to choose the right ERP system that can be put into use with minimum or no customisation. Wrong selection of ERP system take more time for implementation and hence the people lose their hope and may have to work on parallel run for a long time. This eventually kills the ERP project. Total cost of ownership This a important aspect. We need to know the cost and saving out of the ERP system. Return on Investment is very vital in an ERP project. If the saving are lesser than the cost then the Purpose of ERP will be defeated. ERP project team The mind share of the Technical team and functional team to stay committed till the ERP system is put into effective use and every one in the organisation has the bye-in Implementation sequence Chakout a detailed project plan with he ERP vendor and mark each activity and roles and responsibilities. Ensure both the consulting and user group are in sync
